info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 7:17AM CDT until June 14 at 10:30AM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Galveston.
* WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southeastern League City, Galveston Causeway, Galveston Island West End, Texas City, Dickinson, La Marque, Santa Fe, Hitchcock, Kemah, Galveston Pier 21, Bayou Vista, Jamaica Beach, Tiki Island, Offatts Bayou, Scholes Field, Moody Gardens, San Leon, Schlitterbahn, Pelican Island and Galveston Island East End. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING
